posts.post_content:
This and [Crystallization](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crystallization) sure beats using [pacifisim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pacifisim); though I think **Pillory of the Sleepless** is the FAR better of the three, where it makes the creature useless and drains it's controller :D
  
Pacifisim is just so basic and dull/boring.... Me playing that was sure short lived lol...
  
   
**@Aboleth11 (11/24/2009 12:48:17 PM)**    
   
OMG that is an awesome combo! {B} then another {1}{W}{B} to deal **THREE** points of damage to them on each of their turns XD That's just freakin' awesome, simple and sickning!
  
Never seen or heard of that [Sleeper Agent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sleeper Agent) card before... I almost tempted to try to get a set LOL :D

Posted By: DarthParallax (8/3/2011 1:31:15 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@kitsunewarlock: what card are you looking at? normal auras do not have races, and Phyrexians didn't reenter magic until 4-5 years later.  
  
Anyway, This card is amazing, allowing you to neutralize your opponents biggest creatures while making them suffer at the same time. very cheap to play as well. The only thing that could make this card better is if it prohibited activated abilities as well, although that is a bit too much to ask for at this cost. This, [Faith's fetters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faith's fetters), [doomblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doomblade) and [Mortify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mortify) make up my removal suite in my Orzhov multiplayer deck. It draws aggro really quickly, but hey, someone has to, and at least i will be able to use my opponents' life as a buffer to stay at roughly the same total while they slowly wither away as i kill their creatures as well.
posts.html:
@kitsunewarlock: what card are you looking at? normal auras do not have races, and Phyrexians didn't reenter magic until 4-5 years later.

Anyway, This card is amazing, allowing you to neutralize your opponents biggest creatures while making them suffer at the same time. very cheap to play as well. The only thing that could make this card better is if it prohibited activated abilities as well, although that is a bit too much to ask for at this cost. This, Faith's fetters, doomblade and Mortify make up my removal suite in my Orzhov multiplayer deck. It draws aggro really quickly, but hey, someone has to, and at least i will be able to use my opponents' life as a buffer to stay at roughly the same total while they slowly wither away as i kill their creatures as well.
